texts.value: ALDHs play a major role in the detoxification of alcohol-derived acetaldehyde (Probable). They are involved in the metabolism of corticosteroids, biogenic amines, neurotransmitters, and lipid peroxidation (Probable). Oxidizes medium and long chain aldehydes into non-toxic fatty acids (PubMed:1737758). Preferentially oxidizes aromatic aldehyde substrates (PubMed:1737758). Comprises about 50 percent of corneal epithelial soluble proteins (By similarity). May play a role in preventing corneal damage caused by ultraviolet light (By similarity)

reaction.name: an aldehyde + NAD(+) + H2O = a carboxylate + NADH + 2 H(+)
octanal + NAD(+) + H2O = octanoate + NADH + 2 H(+)

texts.value: Has a high Km for acetaldehyde.
High levels in stomach, esophagus and lung; low level in the liver and kidney
Belongs to the aldehyde dehydrogenase family
